VISITONS MIMI
Elementary French
Series I
Grade 2
Foreword
This series of fourteen programs is designed to introduce to the boys and
girls of the second grade a few simple, everyday things in the French language
and about France*
The introduction of foreign language instruction in the elementary schools
of our nation is receiving wide acceptance* The following quotation is from
a speech by Earl J. McGrath, who was until recently United States Commissioner
of Education.
uThe United States is, whether we like it or not, in a position of world
leadership. If it is to discharge its responsibilities wisely and well, our
citizens must understand other peoples and other cultures. To gain such
understanding many Americans must command a knowledge of other languages.
If they are to acquire these language skills, our school system must provide
opportunity, beginning in the early grades, for many children to study other
tongues."
Submitted by the Members of the Foreign Language
Radio Planning Committee:
Martha Casey, Bryan Hill, Chairman
Frances N. Merwin, Stix
Caroline Moreell, Beaumont High School
Samuel Oliveri, Harris Teachers College
Ralph Perry, Harris Teachers College
Juanita Randall, Michael
Ruth Stephens, Gundlach
Most KSLH series are planned by Radio Planning Committees and are based on the
Courses of Study of the St. Louis Public Schools. They are designated for
specific grade levels; however, this does not preclude their use in other
grades if they contribute something worthwhile to the listeners.
